Yesterday we visited the Shockey Dairy Farm in Jackson County. In the Shockey family dairy production is all hands on deck! Joe and Rachel Shockey run the second generation dairy operation with lots of help from their 4 children. Here at the farm more than 200 cows are milked 3 times each day and eat about 100 pounds of feed. Calves are a very important part of a dairy farm and we were lucky enough yesterday to have the chance to see an hours old calf and even fed some older ones.

This evening in South Charleston a fantastic group of conservatives from all over West Virginia gathered for the West Virginia Republican Party Life, Liberty, & Leadership dinner! Senator Capito was honored to be featured as the evening's keynote speaker.
I applaud the hard work of the West Virginia Legislature in making broadband access across the Mountain State a priority!
